div.sent: You have learnt how to make a rope and a braid rope.
Looking at the pictures you will remember how to make ropes and braids, so it is not mentioned here.
You have learnt how to make jute table mats too.
Let us make more beautiful table mats and dolls.
The main material-jute can be found everywhere and anytime in the country.
You will be able to collect these things easily.
Make 6 mm.
wide and about 3 mm.
The braid should be made as long as necessary.
So, that the mat can be completed.
Nearly 60-65 metre braid may be needed.
If there is more no harm, it may be needed later, colour 15-20 meter braid.
What colour will you put? Brown colour will match with the jute-colour.
You will get powder colour in the market, which can be mixed with the water.
Brown colour can be prepared by mixing green with red colour.
If there is more green in proportion then the brown colour will be blackish.
You may put other colours too, as you like.
But make sure colour of the jute does not look odd.
Mix the powder colours with the water in the big or small pot then put your jute-braid into the colour for an hour.
After that take out the coloured braid and dry it.
Insert coloured thread same as your coloured braid into the needle.
In another needle insert the brown coloured thread.
The preliminary work is done.
Now let us begin the main task.
While, rolling over and over, hold your braid in vertical position by the wide side, wind tightly and sew everytime while winding up the braid.
So that the coil of the jute-braid will he strong and the shape will not be bad.
When, 7 centimeter of diameter has been done cut the braid and sew it nicely so that the fibers of jute can not be seen.
It should be noticed that some how the fibers of jute do not come out in strands (or unevenly).
That's why the edge of' the braid should be tightened with the same coloured thread as the braid and then should be cut.
Now take the brown coloured braid, sew and Join the brown braid with the white one where it was stopped.
Roll it twice in the coil with the brown braid.
Cut and separate the surplus brown braid after completing two lines and sew the edge.
Then sew the edge of the white braid with the coil and make ways repeatedly around the coil.
Sew every wave and complete the whole coil, this way.
The height of the wares would not be more than 21_2 centimeter.
Completing this line cut the braid and keep it separate; The measurement of every one should be the same.
If one is small, other is big, and one is very high another is low it will not look nice.
Then sew another row of makes with brown coloured braid in the white coloured waves just, like the white row.
Sew nicely two edges of the braid together completing the waves and cut out the surplus part of the braid.
The waves of brown colour and white colour will be attached so closely, that it will be strong.
Have a look and see how beautiful the 12 centimeter diameter table- mat looks!
You can use it under a tea-cap, saucer, bowl or a tea pot.
Let us try to make this table-mat bigger for the dining-table plates or any other uses.
Don't you agree?
Taking a white braid fix it with your completed table-mat by sewing.
Now roll up the braid on the waves carefully and sew it with every wave.
Be careful, so that the rolled-coil stays in place.
Wind the roll of the white braid repeatedly and sew.
When the coil is 17 centimeter diameter, cut out the white braid and sew the edge of the braid neatly.
Then join the brown-braid and sew in tow rows.
Remember that, after every row of braid you have to fix it with the former one, neatly.
The height of the waves would be about 4 centimeter.
Every wave will be the same size.
Make another row with - the brown coloured braid, fixing it with the white waves thoroughly, just like the white one.
Completing this, cut out the braid and sew perfectly.
Now cut off the surplus part of the braid separately.
See, how beautifully a 25 centimeter diameter table-mat has been made.
You can make small and big or middle sized mats this way.
The table-mats may be of various sizes according to your need.
Usually the mats are used in a set not one separately.
All mats of a set are made of the same design.
There are six mats in a set.
So it won's he enough to learn to make only one mat of a design.
Skill for making necessary numbers of mats of the same design should be acquired.
Since now you have made mats that are round.
If you try a bit you will be able to make mats of different types and shapes.
Such as Oval, Long, Square, Rectangular etc. Generally the procedures to make these mats are more or less: the same.
But the beginning is different.
Let us make a tow ends round long mat Take a white braid and bind one end swing it.
Fold it when it is 7 centimeter long, keep the width of it in a vertical position.
Now sew the first folding and tack it.
Turn the braid over and over following your shape and in turning sew each time properly.
Do this ten times.
You will see that, two ends of the flat coil has became half-circle and a long small mat.
The more turn your braid over and over the mat will be bigger.
If you put coloured braid in the middle it will be more attractive.
Cut off the white braid after your -required size of the mat and sew the edge of the braid properly.
Then make waves with white coloured braid around the coil and sew the ends of the braid.
After that put another row of waves on the coloured one with white braid and complete your mat.
If you wish you can make other things in this process too.
You can make a door- mat.
You will have to use thick braid (7 cm. at least) sewed with thick and strong thread or jute-thread.
It won't need to make the waves.
You have to remember one thing that, at the beginning the longer as you keep the braid, the longer will be your mat.
Such as If you want to make the mat 5 cm.
longer in the width, then keep 5 cm.
first and fold the braid.
And if you want 7 cm.
long in the length, keep 7 cm. of braid and then-fold.
For the door-mat if you want to make 15 cm.
Counting in this process you will be able to decide the sizes and shapes of your mats or door-mats as you like.
You can make beautiful dolls with jute easily.
If you learn the simple and easy methods of making dolls, you will be able to make different beautiful dolls with your imagination.
Let us begin to make a doll.
At first you have to make a structure of a doll which you want to make.
Take two pieces 15 cm.
long wire, having 6 cm. of two wires apart holding together equaly, roll 2 cm.
like a rope.
look at the first picture then you can understand easily.
Bending the wires, make the primary shape of the doll looking at the picture.
Then take a bunch of jute of 3 cm.
diameter, comb this well, to make it even and smooth.
After combing, it will be 21_2 cm.
Cut off the waste parts of the jute.
So that the smoothest part of the bunch remains upto 30 cm. in length.
Bind in the middle of the bunch of jute tightly with thread.
This ball will be about 21_2 cm.
The doll looks-more beautiful with a fine rope of jute than the thread of qunny.
Take the frame of the doll which is ready with wires.
It has the frame of two.
hands and two legs.
Then put aika glue in theremaining jute to make it swing.
Begin to roll from top of the wire and roll the thread tightly, leave l cm.
jute fibre and put aika glue.
In this waythe hands and legs of the doll .
have been done (Look at the pictures).
Now if you fix the head and body the doll will be completed.
You have done the head before the hand.
Roll upthe neck and fix the head with knots, firmly with two small bunches of jute fibre, taking one .
from the front the other from the back of the shoulders.
Take another bunch of jute fibre.
In a fluffy condition it will be 31_2 cm.
Comb it well to make it smooth, cut the surface jute-fibres from the both sides, keeping the smooth part.
Then folding the bunch of the smooth-fibre in the middle, hang it on two shoulders.
Then mix the bunch of the smooth-fibre in the middle, hang it on two shoulders.
Bind and 1put knots with the thread by rolling 3-4 times from 21_2 cm.
below from the shoulders.
The binding place is the waist of the doll.
Notice that, the bunch of the hung jute fibre should be spread fluffily around the frame under the waist equally.
Then cut off the surplus jute evenly with scissorskeeping 31_2 cm.
length of the jute.
The frock of the doll has been done.
The doll is almost done.
Then put aika glue on the head from the middle to the back side of the head.
Then put a little jute fibre on the gum spreading equally from the middle of the fibre.
Notice it very well that, the coverlet of the jute fibre should cover the head completely.
Looking at the picture, sew it with coloured thread of jute and fix it properly on the above of the forehead.
Sew the back side too.
Then turning the fibres which remained on the forehead, mixed together with the back side fibres and bind with thread.
Then sew the eyes and nose with the needle and thread.
Make a braid of jute fibre and fix it on the waist of the doll with aika or by sewing (Look at the picture).
You can-hang this doll on the wall or any other suitable place.
It will look nice.
A, small and thin rope of jute will be needed to be fixed on the head of the doll to hang it on the wall.
This doll can be kept standing in arty place.
If you want a standing doll then you will have to keep 1 cm.
long wire at the end of the legs in the frame.
You can see so many things made of clay everyday.
You use a few of them in your daily life.
You played with clay dolls, horse, birds etc. in your childhood.
You, the girls used to forget everything when you got earthen toys, cooking pots, Didn't you?
Clay is available in abundance every where.
But, can potters make these things with all types of clay?
No, they can't.
For these works, they need a special type of clay.
The dried clay turns into dust (sand).
This dust flies to our houses and on the other things.
You can take these dusts together in your hand and can dust them off.
But if your hands are wet, then this sticky dust will stick-to your hand, this won't fall if you shake it off.
This gluey existence is one of the qualities of the clay.
A small clod of clay is made of millions and millions of particles of dust.
The tiner clay is, gluey the stickier it will be (clay).
According to this, the clay may be roughly divided into three classes such as sticky-clay, loamy-clay and sandy-clay.
The, sticky- clay is very gluey, loamy clay is roughly.
gluey and sandy clay is less gluey.
The sticky-clay is not so suitable for making things of clay.
The articles made of this clay become much more contracted, when these are dried.
As a result of too much contraction, the shapes of these articles become spoiled and may crack.
The loamy- clay is not so gluey so that the forms and shapes of the articles cannot be made as one's desire, sometimes they crack.
So its form, or shape won't be so much cracked.
It is almost impossible to make an article with sandy-clay.
Though air article is made thick, after drying it will collapse when it is moved a bit.
So, for making an article, the clay is prepared properly by blending sticky and loamy clay in equal proportions, considering their qualities.
This blended clay is called sticky-loamy clay.
Any form, thick or thin shape of any article can be made with this clay.
It shrinks very little at the time of drying and firing, so the shapes or forms of the articles do not change or get deformed.
To make any earthen article the clay should be prepared properly for the work.
You have learnt the preparation of clay in class six, yet it is told here in short.
This is very important, because if the clay is not prepared well, any work would not be done.
You can prepare clay in two very, easy methods.
Make clay powder grinding a clod of clay as grinding of rice powder.
You can grind it with a stone slab or flat, mortar, keeping your clod on the brick-built floor or a low wooden seat.
Sift the clay powder with a sieve of flour.
Put necessary amount of water in the powder and mixing it well making the paste like flour paste.
It will not be suitable if it is very hard or very soft.
Take the paste in your palm of the hands and bring out the air, pressing the paste of the clay.
Put one third small dried clod of clay into an earthen manger and add two third of clean water in the manager.
Then put a lid on the manger and keep it for two to three days like this.
When the clay becomes very soft or muddy then mix the mud well with the remaining water.
Keep another earthen manger beside this one.
Now sift the whey of the mixed clay with a wooden sieve and fine wire keeping it on the 2nd earthen manger.
Then keep this sifted whey covered with a lid for one day.
Next day you will see that the clay whey sank slowly in thee bottom of the manger and the clean water is on the top.
Throw out the water with a small cup carefully.
After two days you will see that the clay-whey became like mud and there is again clean water on the top of the manger.
Throw out the water again with a cup very carefully, so that the mud would not be moved.
Keep it for two days more covering with a lid until you find the Soft mud like butter.
Then keep the soft mud spreading on a thick cloth or a gunny into the house or in the veranda/corridor of a house.
If the polythene is not available then you may keep it wrapped with a wet- cloth.
If you sprinkly water when the cloth is a little hit dried, then the clay will remain soft forma number of days.
There are potters everywhere in our country.
The children, who live in the villages near the potter's house have seen, how the potters make things in a moment by turning the wheels.
The wheels with which the potters make clay-vessels is called the potter's wheel.
The men used to make potteries in different processes before the invention of this wheel.
To make pots putting on the clay coil one after another is one of those process.
We call it Coil in English.
For that reason, this procedure is known as a Coil System.
Now let us make a beautiful pot.
Materials and tools are needed to make any thing.
A pot will be made with clay, so the clay is its material.
The pot will be made in the coil-system, so there is no need of so many instruments or tools for this method.
A roller, made of wood.
If it is not available then a tube/pipe of a bamboo.
A knife, made of a thin slip of bamboo (Scrapped in one end pointed and the other end blunt).
A Modeling tool made of a thin slip of wood (Looking at the picture it can be made easily).
A Modeling tool is a slightly thick wire bending its end fixed it in a wood stick or a bamboo-stick.
(Looking at the picture it can be made easily).
Do you know, what is meant by a coil?
So you can understand that, the coil is a thing which is made by rolling anything.
You will make a coil system pot.
What kind of pot will you make?
A flower vase?
Yes make an easy long vase like a cylinder tube.
If you can make this, you will be able to make other vessels as you like using your imaginations.
Draw a design of your vase on a paper before.
The design is a kind of picture.
The length, width and height, these three dimension of any thing can be found in a picture.
But the identity of one side can be seen in a design, so drawing have to be done for different sides, separately.
The vase which you are going to make is like a round cylinder.
It is same from every side.
It has a diameter and height, so if you draw the diameter and the height of the design that will be enough.
Looking at the picture, this will be clear to you.
You will have to learn how to make the coil, before making the flower vase.
It is not possible to roll a small and soft clay cold round.
This clay clod is needed to be rolled up thin and long (lengthwise).
Take a small clod of clay.
Keep it in your palms of hands and press it slightly and move it by rolling in front and back.
Look, the clay clod has become long enough.
Look, the clay has become like a long creeper.
To make this you will need to move your hands not only front or back but both of the sides equally.
You can make various things, if it is as fat as a wooden pencil.
Cut the coil as much a bangle and join two ends and make a bangle.
If the coil is cut slanting, the joining becomes nice.
Wet two ends of the coil with water before joining.
Now, let us make the flower vase.
Keep the design of the flower vase in front of you which was drawn by you.
Make 11_2 a cm.
thick clay-slab like a chapati, with a small clod of clay by rolling with a roller, to make the bottom of the flower vase.
The clay- slab should be cut according to its measurement of the design of the flower-vase.
Then make a coil bangle according to the measurement of the bottom part of the clay-slab.
Now put the clay bangle making it wet on the bottom part of the clay-slab.
Now put the clay-bangle making it wet on the bottom part properly by its side.
Be careful so that the round shape of the coil does not be ruined.
Every measurement of the coil will be of the same diameter because the form of the vase is long like a barrel.
It will be difficult to make the inside of the vase smooth if it is too high.
For that reason make smooth and even inside the vase pulling and rubbing with-a wooden modeling tool after putting five or six coils.
Then after putting five or six coils make smooth and even in the same process inside the flower vase.
Notice that, the folds of the coils remain intact, out side the flower vase.
Completing the work of making the flower vase as the same height of the design, stop it.
Taking it in your hand see how it is to look at; It may not be.
similar to your design, it may be uneven or zigzag.
Don't be disappointed.
At the beginning it may he disappointing after making a few it will be all right.
Different kinds of flower vases and other pots and articles can be made with these clay-coils.
But, draw the design taking measurement of whatever you want to make.
Then you will decide how thick or big coil you will use for these.
Otherwise you will not be able to make things with coils to your likings/choices.
There are a few designs of pots, following these pictures.
You might have done a few things with cotton and cloth.
You have done a picture of a duck with cotton, an ordinary cushion too, havn't you?
This time make a more beautiful picture.
A decorative flower vase with various coloured flowers and leaves, then a bird and at last a cushion with cover.
A Picture which you will make this time, will be red, white, yellow orange violet etc. various coloured flowers green leaves and stems.
It will be a flower vase, so you will need different coloured cotton.
The powder colours which is to dissolved in the water can be found in the market.
It all colours cannot be found, you can get the necessary colours by mixing one colour with another.
If you mix a little red colour with this, then this colour will be leaf green.
Colour your cotton before and dry the colour you want to use in your picture.
Draw the picture on a paper which you want to do in cotton.
You will have to draw the picture as big as the picture of the cotton you want to make.
There will be different coloured flowers so the flowers will be of different classes and shapes, big-small in sizes.
The forms and shapes of various types of flowers and leaves will be different also.
Draw the picture considering all these factors.
Now putting a carbon paper's black side on a white paper, keep your drawing on it.
Fix these papers together with clips so that they cannot more.
Then draw farce the lines of the picture with a pencil.
You can see that the picture is printed on the paper on reverse way.
Draw 2-3 more wrong drawings, like this.
Decide which colour will he for which flower by colouring your first picture.
Which colour will be the flower-vase?
The colour of the leaves will be the same.
Take the designs which you've got printed by the carbon paper.
At first cut out the part of the flower vase with scissors.
Looking at the coloured picture, cut the parts of the flowers, keep every coloured flower parts separately one by one.
Keep a little space around the flower vase and flowers when you cut these.
Don't cut just on the line.
You have got more pictures, so it won't be difficult for you.
Then take the cut part one by one and put the flour-gum in the reverse side and put the selected coloured cotton I cm.
thick and press it slightly, so that it may be fixed properly.
Putting the cotton on all the parts of papers, let these be dried.
The black cloth is to be ironed, so that it would not be curled.
See that the cloth on the board is fully tight /stretched.
Nom - decorate these parts on the black cloth which is on the paste-board looking at the coloured picture.
See that the parts of the picture is fixed properly, any part does not come apart.
Now see how the coloured cotton picture looks.
The flowers and leaves look like real, soft flowers and leaves, don't they?
You will be able to make other beautiful pictures an your own in this procedure, if you try.
You can make not only flowers and leaves but people with dresses, birds, animals, trees etc. in this process.
Framing the picture of cotton it may be hung on the wall, it will look very nice.
You have certainly seen birds, animals and many other things made of cotton.
This can be made in different ways and methods.
I will show you a very easy method of making a bird with cotton.
It looks like a flying white cotton pigeon.
It will be interesting to make it.
A little amount of ordinary and some bandage cotton will be needed for this.
At first make a ball like a hard egg with small quantity of ordinary cotton by binding it with thread.
Make another small ball in the same process (Look at the picture).
Following the picture, join the small ball with the big egg putting aika glue or any other strong glue on one of its broad side.
This way the main frame of the bird has been made.
Now the tail and wings of the bird are to be made.
The tail, wings and the frame of the bird have been made.
The beak is left now.
If you fold a small thick paper in triangle it will be the beak of a bird.
Look, what a beautiful bird has been made.
No, Your work is not finished yet.
Up to this only the frame of a bird has been made.
Fix a thin coverlet of cotton with glue on the head and the frame of the bird's body to make it smooth and beautiful.
There is no need to put coverlets of cotton on the tail and wings again.
Colour the beak orange and draw two dots with black colour for two eyes.
Look, how beautiful the bird has been make, just like a white flying pigeon.
If you want to make a coloured bird, then colour the coverlet of cotton before hand.
